page.title: 04B'POOL/FYLDE GLIDING CLUB
page.content: Founded at Squire's Gate, Blackpool in 1950, the Blackpool and Fylde Gliding Club Ltd. purchased its present site at Cock Hill Farm, Chipping,in 1973. The site consists of 50 acres (the grazing being let to neighbouring farmers), a hangar, a clubhouse with facilities for overnight stays and a cottage. The club is run by volunteers. 140 members from as far away as Manchester, Blackpool, Lancaster and Burnley,fly in 5 club-owned gliders(3 single-seaters, 2 x 2 seaters used for instruction) or in 1 of 18 syndicate-owned gliders. Gliders are launched by means of a winch and cable and are supervised from a mobile control rig. Flying takes place at weekends, on public holidays and during several "flying weeks" in the year. There is a waiting list for members.
